sources.data_found: DataUSA profile for University of Oregon Computer and Information Sciences degrees awarded (used for PhD/MS estimation logic).

student_data.notes: Student counts based on Fall 2023 Census data for 'Computer & Information Sciences' major reported by UO Institutional Research. The report lists 897 undergraduates and 98 total graduate students in the CIS major. PhD/MS breakdown is not explicitly stated in the summary report; estimated based on IPEDS completion data (DataUSA) showing approx. 6 PhDs awarded/year (x6 year avg duration = ~36-38 students) and approx. 40 Master's degrees/year (x1.5 year avg duration = ~60 students). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Counts derived from RACS Infrastructure documentation for the Talapas cluster: 3 nodes x 4 A100 (80GB) = 12 A100s; 18 nodes x 2 V100 (32GB) = 36 V100s; 2 nodes x 2 P100 = 4 P100s. No H100 or newer hardware appears in public specifications or partition lists as of May 2024. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: University of Oregon relies on a single primary cluster 'Talapas'. Hardware specs are explicitly listed on the RACS infrastructure page. Student counts are from official Institutional Research census data for the CIS major.
